text: Gentiana punctata, the spotted gentian, is a least concern herbaceous species of flowering plant in the Gentian family Gentianaceae. It grows in Central and Southeastern Europe at altitudes 1.500−2.600 meters. It is 20−60 cm tall. ==References== ==External links== * Kvetiny.atlasrostlin.cz punctata Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus
title: Gentiana punctata
